noun.description: A member of a confederacy of North American peoples of the northeastern plains. The Blackfoot confederacy was made up of three closely related tribes: the Blackfoot proper or Siksika, the Bloods, and the Peigan.
The Algonquian language of the Blackfoot.
A subdivision of the Teton Sioux.

adjective.description: Relating to the Blackfoot or their language.
